enb_long_title: Twentieth Session of the Subsidiary Bodies to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change
sentences: Co-Chair Anders Turesson introduced revised draft conclusions, noting that the text incorporated proposals from the EU, G-77/CHINA, and US.

SAUDI ARABIA, for the G-77/China, opposed by the US, EU, AUSTRALIA and JAPAN, suggested deleting text referring to decision 13/CP.7 (P&Ms), preferring instead to include language from the same decision.
Co-Chair Turesson proposed to include the decision language while retaining the option to refer to the decision, depending on negotiations on the remaining text.
On exchange of information on P&Ms, JAPAN, opposed by the G-77/CHINA, proposed adding reference to sectoral differences.
The G-77/CHINA requested to delete wording that indicated exchange of 'any information' by non-Annex I Parties by SBSTA-22.
Following informal consultations, reference to sectoral differences and 'any information' was removed and agreement was reached on the draft conclusions.
